snippet: Sean Quinn, a man who once had businesses worth $5.2 billion, will spend nine weeks in jail for contempt that a Dublin judge called “nothing short of outrageous.”
abstract: Former Irish billionaire Sean Quinn is sentenced to nine weeks in jail for contempt for failing to disclose assets he was hiding abroad; Quinn's 4 billion euro business empire collapsed after a disastrous investment in the now failed Anglo Irish Bank and he is the first major player jailed in connection with the country's economic collapse.
lead_paragraph: Sean Quinn, a man who once had businesses worth $5.2 billion, will spend nine weeks in jail for contempt that a Dublin judge called “nothing short of outrageous.”

headline.seo: Ireland Jails Sean Quinn, Once Its Richest Man
headline.main: Irish Ex-Billionaire Is Jailed for Failing to Disclose Assets
headline.print_headline: Irish Ex-Billionaire Is Jailed For Failing to Disclose Assets
